0: Image copyright AFP Image caption Cameroonian security forces have joined a regional battle against Boko Haram militants NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR About 80 children rescued from a Boko Haram camp in Cameroon cannot remember their own names or origins, according to an aid official who visited them. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The children - aged between 5 and 18 - did not speak English, French or any local languages, says Christopher Fomunyoh, a director for the US-based National Democratic Institute (NDI). NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The children were found at a camp in northern Cameroon in November. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Nigeria-based Boko Haram militants have extended their campaign into Cameroon. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The militants are fighting to establish an Islamic caliphate in north-eastern Nigeria. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR They control several towns and villages in the region and recently pledged allegiance to Islamic State (IS) militants, who have seized large areas of Syria and Iraq. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR 'Lost touch' NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The children were rescued in Cameroon after security forces - acting on a tip-off - raided what was thought to have been a Koranic school. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Mr Fomunyoh told the BBC's Randy Joe Sa'ah in Yaounde that he had visited an orphanage that was helping rehabilitate the children. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR He said the children had spent so long with their captors, being indoctrinated in jihadist ideology, that they had lost track of who they were. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR "They've lost touch with their parents," he said. "They've lost touch with people in their villages, they're not able to articulate, to help trace their relationships, they can't even tell you what their names are." NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Meanwhile, a suspected Boko Haram attack on Tuesday killed at least six people at a marketplace in the northern Nigerian town of Maiduguri. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The suicide bombing was reportedly carried out by a middle-aged woman.
